Description: Funerary papyrus of Peftjauawyenmont containing Second Book of Breathing written in hieratic script. Demotic text on the verso.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Egypt, Thebes? Possibly from the tomb of the archon Soter, but apparently unconnected with his family (see Herbin 2008, 90).
Curator's comments: Bibliography: E.A. Wallis Budge, A Guide to the Fourth, Fifth and Sixth Egyptian Rooms (London 1922), p. 296, no.9. B.H. Stricker, OMRO 23 (1942), p.33. Herbin, F.-R., Books of Breathing and Related Texts (Catalogue of the Books of the Dead and Other Related Texts in the British Museum IV), London, 2008, pp. 90-100, pls. 57-59.
Bibliographic references: Quirke 1993 / Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (200)
Herbin 2008 / Books of Breathing and Related Texts (pp.90-100, pls.57-59)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (57779) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/57779)
Vleeming 2015 / Demotic graffiti and other short texts gathered from many publications (no.2000, p.348)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink 10111 displayed in Room 63 until 1997 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: self adhesive tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: fair
